page.title: 17AUCHTERMUCHTY..HOUSING
page.content: Our D_Block covers only a small section of Auchtermuchty on the eastern side. Bow Road is the oldest road, first developed in the late 1600s with some houses being added in the early 18th century. Bow Road was probably the main road but was flooded by water collecting on the lower ground. This made tracks too muddy for carriages so a road was built slightly higher up_ namely the Cupar road(A91). Housing was built around the road, as well as along a road which branched off_middleflat. Sandstone houses and cottages with thatched roofs were built. Many of the original houses remain but only two thatched cottages currently remain in our D_Block_ one adjacent to the Cupar road and the other midway along Bow Road.
